content.description: Start on the obvious low crimp incut edges. Make a large move straight up to a jug.  Then follow the crimps/pinches up to a diagonal jug and slopey top out. Try not to touch the tree! Although the guidebook does say most people use the "Leg-Tree hook" Stand start on the jug is a V4.
content.location: Up and around the corner from crash and burn. Immediately to the left of the 1.5ft wide tree. Middle Fiddle Boulder, facing west.

content.description: A great arete climb! Start on a pinch on the right face, make a move to get high feet, and rock over onto the left side of the arete. Climb it through a few slopers and make a long reach up right to a hidden pocket. From here, use the help of a hidden undercling on the right face to find a decent hold to top out with.
content.location: The arete on the far left side of the Fiddle Block.

content.description:
Start standing using a pinch on your left (shared hold with Groovin' Missionary) and a sidepull crack in the orange streak. Follow the seam using pockets, crimps and gastons around the seam to a good leftward angled ledge and a sloper. Top-out straight up.

This route is route #9 on Boulder 1: Fiddle Block in the Brayack and Keenan Falcon guidebook.
content.location: Follows the seam above a very noticeable orange streak and is in the middle of several flake systems.

content.description: A great but desperately thin slab problem! Start on a high pinch and whatever else you can get ahold of and ascend the less than vertical face using impossible feeling "holds" to a sharp sidepull. Make a balancey move to a good pinch and then a dicey move to the top of the block.
content.location: Just left of "Sloping Rail" right where a few rocks are protruding from the ground right against the slab.

content.description: Stand start directly under the sloping rail and use thin but gritty edges to stand up on questionable smears. Keep your core tight and move up to the sloping rail and topout.
content.location: Directly in the middle of the Fiddle Boulder, between the classic Stick With It and The Fiddle.

content.description: An insecure slabby route with very smeary feet. Start just left of "The Fiddle" on a right facing edge. Make a thin move to get to the sloping rail and follow it up and left to the top.
content.location: Just left of "The Fiddle" near the middle of the block.

content.description: Start to the left of the large flake, just left of "FFF" and follow the path of least resistance through good edges and jugs to the top. Step up on the noticeable platform foot and reach up to the first good edge to start. This is also a convenient downclimb for the rest of the problems in order to avoid walking off of the back of the block.
content.location: Left of the large flake and just left of "FFF".

content.description:
Start on inward opposing sidepulls above the large talus. Make a long first move to a sidepull, then pull up to a good crimp and easy topout.

This route is # 7 on Boulder 1: Fiddle Block (aka Hall of Fame Boulder) in the Brayack & Keenan guidebook
content.location: Start on eye-level inward opposing sidepulls above the large talus. About 10 ft right of the orange streak

content.description:
Start standing with hands on a pocket and a sidepull pinch. Move up right through holds on the flake to a Gaston. Get your feet set and make a big move to a good rail up and left using an undercling intermediate if you need to. Easy top-out straight up.

This route is route #10 on Boulder 1: Fiddle Block in the Brayack and Keenan Falcon guidebook.
content.location: Start is right of Tombstone Arete just left of the prominent flake.

content.description: Short and sweet. Start by standing up into a good ledge, then stepping out to a shallow pocket.  From the pocket throw up to the lip, topping out to the left.
content.location: The angled face as you approach the first Fiddle Area Boulder on the main trail.

content.description: Start with feet on two opposing angled rocks and go straight up past a tricky/balance crux sequence to a deep breath pocket. Top out from there.
content.protection: a few pads to protect protruding rocks
content.location: Main Fiddle Boulder with Tombstone Arete to Climber's left.

content.description: A fun moderate. Start using jugs and step up to an undercling. Climb through a few more edges and a fun high step move to the top.
content.location: Just to the left of the large flake on the right side of the block.

content.description: Sit start and use a pocket and a hollow pinch to fire up to a sloper. Power through a few more slopers and jugs to a nice top out
content.location: Located on the block just before the Fiddle Block. It is a few routes to the right of Crash and Burn and just to the left of Butter Face on the right corner of the block.

content.description: A great power-endurance problem that is often overlooked! Start on a right facing slot then move up and left to a horizontal rail. Traverse left using jugs and slopers to a few good holds on the arete. Once on the arete, fight the pump and do a fun mantle to finish. To get down, have someone move a pad and jump. The finishing holds on the arete tend to collect dirt and leaves so be sure to clean them off beforehand.
content.protection: Multiple pads and a spotter, the landing isn't the best for the first half of the problem.
content.location: This problem located is directly across from "Crash and Burn" on it's own boulder.

content.description: Only about 7-8 moves but a ton of fun packed into a small space. Sit start on deep crimps and move up past left side-pulls to a slope ledge.  From here there are a couple ways to top out.  One being a head-height heel and a second being a couple of invisible feet and throwing to one of two decent crimps on the top lip. From here feel good edges past the lip and walk around the back side of the boulder which lets out at the 1st Fiddle boulder
content.protection: Get a bunch of pads (3-4) if you want to protect nicely.  Flat rocks have been conveniently placed at the landing zone to help prevent rolled ankles when landing on pads.

content.description:
Start the same as Cyrax, sitting with hands on a pocket and a sidepull pinch. Move up to the sloping ledge and follow the sloping ledge left gaining a crucial kneebar. Continue up and left through more slopers at the sickly tree and top out straight up through jugs just left of the tree.

This route is #18c on Boulder 2: Wave Rider Boulder in the Brayack and Keenan Falcon guidebook.
content.location: The start of this route is about 6 feet to the right of the sickly tree growing out of the rock in the middle of the face.

content.description: Sit start in front of a small tree and power off of a low sloper to a jug. Climb past a few more slopers to an enjoyable top out.
content.location: Located on the block just before the Fiddle Block. It is on the opposite corner as Crash and Burn and just to the right of Cyrax on the very right corner of the block.
